"But come<WH7126> here,<WH2008> you sons<WH1121> of a sorceress,<WH6049> Offspring<WH2233> of an adulterer<WH5003> and a prostitute.<WH2181>

"Among the smooth<WH2509> [stones] of the ravine<WH5158> Is your portion,<WH2506> they are your lot;<WH1486> Even<WH1571> to them you have poured<WH8210> out a libation,<WH5262> You have made<WH5927> a grain offering.<WH4503> Shall I relent<WH5162> concerning<WH5921> these<WH428> things<WH428>?
"Upon a high<WH1364> and lofty<WH5375> mountain<WH2022> You have made<WH7760> your bed.<WH4904> You also<WH1571> went<WH5927> up there<WH8033> to offer<WH2076> sacrifice.<WH2077>

"And behind<WH310> the door<WH1817> and the doorpost<WH4201> You have set<WH7760> up your sign;<WH2146> Indeed,<WH3588> far removed<WH4480> from Me, you have uncovered<WH1540> yourself; And have gone<WH5927> up and made<WH7337> your bed<WH4904> wide.<WH7337> And you have made<WH3772> an agreement for yourself with them, You have loved<WH157> their bed,<WH4904> You have looked<WH2372> on [their] manhood.<WH3027>

"And you have journeyed<WH7788> to the king<WH4428> with oil<WH8081> And increased<WH7235> your perfumes;<WH7547> You have sent<WH7971> your envoys<WH6735> a great distance,<WH7350> And made [them] go<WH8213> down<WH8213> to Sheol.<WH7585>

"You were tired<WH3021> out by the length<WH7230> of your road,<WH1870> [Yet] you did not say,<WH559> 'It is hopeless.<WH2976>' You found<WH4672> renewed<WH2416> strength,<WH3027> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> you did not faint.<WH2470>

"Of whom<WH4310> were you worried<WH1672> and fearful,<WH3372> When<WH3588> you lied,<WH3576> and did not remember<WH2142> Me, Nor<WH3808> give<WH7760> [Me] a thought<WH3820>? Was I not silent<WH2814> even for a long<WH5769> time<WH5769> So you do not fear<WH3372> Me?
"I will declare<WH5046> your righteousness<WH6666> and your deeds,<WH4639> But they will not profit<WH3276> you.

"When you cry<WH2199> out, let your collection<WH6899> [of idols] deliver<WH5337> you. But the wind<WH7307> will carry<WH5375> all<WH3605> of them up, And a breath<WH1892> will take<WH3947> [them away.] But he who takes<WH2620> refuge<WH2620> in Me shall inherit<WH5157> the land,<WH776> And shall possess<WH3423> My holy<WH6944> mountain.<WH2022>"
And it shall be said,<WH559> "Build<WH5549> up, build<WH5549> up, prepare<WH6437> the way,<WH1870> Remove<WH7311> [every] obstacle<WH4383> out of the way<WH1870> of My people.<WH5971>"

For thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the high<WH7311> and exalted<WH5375> One Who lives<WH7931> forever,<WH5703> whose name<WH8034> is Holy,<WH6918> "I dwell<WH7931> [on] a high<WH4791> and holy<WH6918> place, And [also] with the contrite<WH1793> and lowly<WH8217> of spirit<WH7307> In order to revive<WH2421> the spirit<WH7307> of the lowly<WH8217> And to revive<WH2421> the heart<WH3820> of the contrite.<WH1792>

"For I will not contend<WH7378> forever,<WH5769> Neither<WH3808> will I always<WH5331> be angry;<WH7107> For the spirit<WH7307> would grow<WH5848> faint<WH5848> before<WH4480> <WH6440> Me, And the breath<WH5397> [of those whom] I have made.<WH6213>

"Because of the iniquity<WH5771> of his unjust<WH1215> gain<WH1215> I was angry<WH7107> and struck<WH5221> him; I hid<WH5641> [My face] and was angry,<WH7107> And he went<WH1980> on turning<WH7726> away,<WH7726> in the way<WH1870> of his heart.<WH3820>
"I have seen<WH7200> his ways,<WH1870> but I will heal<WH7495> him; I will lead<WH5148> him and restore<WH9608> comfort<WH5150> to him and to his mourners,<WH57>

Creating<WH1254> the praise<WH5108> of the lips.<WH8193> Peace,<WH7965> peace<WH7965> to him who is far<WH7350> and to him who is near,<WH7138> "Says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068>" and I will heal<WH7495> him. "
But the wicked<WH7563> are like the tossing<WH1644> sea,<WH3220> For it cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> be quiet,<WH8252> And its waters<WH4325> toss<WH1644> up refuse<WH7516> and mud.<WH2916>
"There<WH369> is no<WH369> peace,<WH7965>" says<WH559> my God,<WH430> "for the wicked.<WH7563>"
